name: HD 47366
scenarioDescription:
The HD 47366 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 47366 is a star with 2.19 times the mass of the Sun, and 6.2 times its radius. It is located 275.80 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.94 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 47366 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 47366 system


HD 47366 b

HD 47366 b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.28 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 47366 b is 731.4 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 47366 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 47366 c

HD 47366 c was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.97 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 47366 c is 597.8399999999999 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 47366 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 47366, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
